de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.api

Interface IMenu

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.spongepowered.api.util.Identifiable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseMenuImpl, BoundMenuImpl

    public interface IMenu
extends org.spongepowered.api.util.Identifiable
    The menu is a collection of IElements that are bound to the menu and spread across pages. In addition to elements the menu also contains StateObjects for the menu itself and each player that might interact with the menu.
    The rendering mechanism is not important to the menu itself, it only provides the structure and functionality for the menu.
    Copying a menu will copy every element and state, while creating a bound instance will only copy the elements and still reference the base menus states.

      • getBackground

        BackgroundProvider getBackground()
        Every non-occupied slot in a GuiRenderer can be populated by a BackgroundProvider
        Returns:
        the BackgroundProvider for this menu

      • setBackgroundProvider

        void setBackgroundProvider(BackgroundProvider background)
        Sets the BackgroundProvider for this menu. The background should update once the GuiRenderer revalidates the menu.
        Parameters:
        background - a BackgroundProvider implementation providing IIcons for empty slots

      • setPositionProvider

        void setPositionProvider(PositionProvider provider)
        Sets the position provider, that automatically positions elements in a menu upon adding them. Calling this function will reset any previously tracked position throughout the menu.
        Parameters:
        provider - the new PositionProvider

      • pages

        int pages()
        This value will automatically be set by the highest page an element was added to.
        Returns:
        the amount of pages.

      • add

        void add(int page,
         IElement element)
        Add an IElement to the specified page
        Adding alements to a page beyond the first (page 1) will automatically enable pagination.
        Parameters:
        page - the page to add the element to (1 based)
        element - the IElement implemetation to add

      • addAll

        void addAll(int page,
            java.util.Collection<? extends IElement> elements)
        Add all IElements to the specified page.
        Adding alements to a page beyond the first (page 1) will automatically enable pagination.
        Parameters:
        page - the page to add the element to (1 based)
        elements - the collection of IElement implementation to add

      • remove

        void remove(int page,
            int x,
            int y)
        remove an element for the page and slot position if present. if as a result the page is empty it will not be remove.
        Parameters:
        page - the page to remove elements from (1 based)
        x - the column in the gui to remove the element from (0 based)
        y - the row in the gui to remove the element from (0 based)

      • remove

        void remove(int page,
            org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos pos)
        remove an element for the page and slot position if present. if as a result the page is empty it will not be remove.
        Parameters:
        page - the page to remove elements from (1 based)
        pos - the 2 dimensional position of the element on the gui page

      • removePage

        void removePage(int page)
        completely remove the page. other pages where the page number > page will move up with their page being reduced by 1.
        this allows clearing all pages with 
        while (pages()>1) removePage(1);
        Parameters:
        page - the page to remove

      • clearPage

        void clearPage(int page)
        unbind and remove all elements from this page. this will keep empty pages in the menu.
        Parameters:
        page - the page to remove

      • getState

        StateObject getState()
        Menu states are copied into copies and children, meaning base values are present in copies, but changes within the states of copies are not reflected in the base state
        Returns:
        the global State object for this menu

      • getPlayerState

        StateObject getPlayerState(java.util.UUID playerID)
        Menu states are copied into copies and children, meaning base values are present in copies, but changes within the states of copies are not reflected in the base state
        Returns:
        the player specific State object for this menu

      • getPlayerState

        default StateObject getPlayerState(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player player)
        Convenience method for getPlayerState(Player::getUniqueId()) Menu states are copied into copies and children, meaning base values are present in copies, but changes within the states of copies are not reflected in the base state
        Returns:
        the player specific State object for this menu

      • createGuiRenderer

        MenuRenderer createGuiRenderer(int pageHeight,
                               boolean bound)
        Create a new GuiRenderer that will handle events and inventory updates.
        Parameters:
        pageHeight - is the number of rows per page in the inventory including the pagination row.
        bound - if true this will create a copy of all elements to draw a non-shared, player-bound instance of this menu. If you create a menu dynamically for a player it's better to not create a bound renderer.
        Throws:
        ObjectBuilderException - when elements are placed below the displayable area.

      • createBookRenderer

        MenuRenderer createBookRenderer(boolean bound)
        Create a new BookRenderer that will handle events and view updates.
        A book has a fixed page height of 15 lines!
        Parameters:
        bound - if true this will create a copy of all elements to draw a non-shared, player-bound instance of this menu. If you create a menu dynamically for a player it's better to not create a bound renderer.
        Throws:
        ObjectBuilderException - when elements are placed below the displayable area.

      • createChatRenderer

        MenuRenderer createChatRenderer(int pageHeight,
                                boolean bound)
        Create a new GuiRenderer that will handle events and inventory updates.
        Parameters:
        pageHeight - is the number of rows per page in the inventory including the pagination row.
        bound - if true this will create a copy of all elements to draw a non-shared, player-bound instance of this menu. If you create a menu dynamically for a player it's better to not create a bound renderer.
        Throws:
        ObjectBuilderException - when elements are placed below the displayable area.

      • invalidate

        default void invalidate()
        Fetches all renderer for this menu from RenderManager and invalidates them. This will cause them to redraw in the near future (usually next tick).

      • invalidate

        default void invalidate(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player player)
        Invalidates this menu for the specified player in the currently opened MenuRenderer through the RenderManager. Will cause the menu to redraw in the near future (usually next tick).

      • copy

        IMenu copy()
        Creates a copy of this menu, copying all states, elements and properties into a new menu.
        All IElement implementations will usually change IDs after copying.
        Returns:
        a copy of this menu with equal elements, states and title
